intro: Phaedranassa glauciflora, commonly known as the blue-flowered phaedranassa, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and grayish-green, and it produces small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
